Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
The IT program for online students and general assistance for email accounts password resets etc., has been really beneficial, because they are always their at odd hours of the day.
Currently I am a member of the American Criminal Justice Association, along with a Greek chapter umbrella under the national chapter.
I have not gotten a chance to interact with some of the clubs due to being a student who is a distance learner.
Accelerated program and online program is great for those who have to work, parents, etc.
One unusual tradition I experience at Tiffin University is the personal interaction that the advisors have, the will do their best to make sure you are able to complete your degree program.
If you want the bang for your buck you will learn to utilize all the university has to offer.
Sandusky is not to far away, with Cedar Point Amusement Park, Kalahari Waterpark and Put in Bay not far their is plenty of things to do.
Never dine on campus.
I have seen the dorms located in a small town.
Like some of the course work was tough, however the professors at Tiffin University made learning a lot more interesting due to their first hand experience within the area of courses.
Understand the program of interest. Check on funding for online, traditional seating, etc. Finally understand college concept of higher learning.

Tiffin has programs and ways to complete your degree without having to change your normal lifestyles, ex: employment. Their are not a lot of scholarships for distance learning so know your options. The accelerated program has been well worth it.
pageTitle: Tiffin University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {23715=The Degree Completing Program is very affordable to students who have had their studies interrupted. It is easy to navigate and get into, if you have basic online proficiency. I am in the Business Administration DCP, and find that it is well-designed for the working adult. The courses are given one at a time for focused study, while maintaining full-time enrollment status. This is the best feature, and makes other drawbacks worth it. The admissions staff is exceptional. Financial aid is lukewarm, especially for online students; it is best to have a backup plan for financing graduation. However, they say that online students enjoy a lower tuition cost then the traditional student does. Pell and FSEOG, yes--early FAFSA on Jan.1 gets the rewards--Perkins, no., 24775=The online forums are mandatory; the quality of discussion with fellow students is very low. Many do not have critical thinking skills and have poor spelling and grammar. The online teacher tolerated multiple incidents of a student plagerizing another students work in the forum posting. This led me to conclude that the instructor is not really reading the posts. If this kind of thing does not bother you, the online program certainly gets the job done, but it is more suitable for the independent-minded person., 147182=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot It is all about how much effort you put into your educational learning experience. I am paying an exorbitant amount of money to go to Tiffin, but I am definitely making the most of my resources and connections here. Login to rate or flag the reviews Kenya from Stone Mountain, GA 05/24/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 6 out of 6 people found this review useful. 3 of 36 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Tiffin is great for all types of students. If you're studious, there are study labs all over campus. If you like involvement, there are tons of clubs and organizations. If you are athletic, there are varsity, junior varsity, and club sports available. If you like music, there are musiic groups that tour regularlty. If you're religious, there are religious groups on campus and churches all around the city of Tiffin. If you like scholarships, they have them!
